numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some families are richer than other families.
2. The graph contains the phrase "Estimated legacy boost".
3. The phrase "Estimated legacy boost" refers to a cycle.
4. If a family has much money then the family can get better education opportunities.
5. If a family has better education opportunities then a child of the family can attend a better college.
6. If a child attends a better college then the legacy of the family increases.
7. If the legacy of a family increases then the family can become richer again.
8. Poorer families often do not have the same education opportunities as richer families.
9. People from poorer families often must work harder.
10. People from poorer families cannot rely much on their financial situation.
11. The data is from the years 1999 to 2015.
12. I wonder how a graph for 2023 would compare to this graph.
13. I wonder whether this problem has become better or worse.
14. I wonder what benefits a school gets if a student has much money.
15. I wonder what benefits a school gets if a student has a legacy.
16. I wonder how this graph would compare to a graph about non-elite colleges.
17. I assume that non-elite colleges are less influenced by money.
18. I assume that non-elite colleges have less legacy influence.
19. I live in a community.
20. In my community, people use the college that a family attends or attended to compare people.
21. This graph shows that this comparison is not fair.
22. Money influences admission to prestigious schools.
23. Relations influence admission to prestigious schools.
24. The headline is: How your family's financial situation can influence your education opportunities.
